title: Antonio Rigamonti
text:
Antonio Rigamonti (born April 5, 1949) is a retired <a href="Italy">Italian</a> professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Career.
Born in <a href="Carate%20Brianza">Carate Brianza</a>, Rigamonti began playing football with Atalanta. He made his <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> debut against Internazionale on 3 October 1971. He played for 6 seasons (61 games, 3 goals) in the <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> for <a href="Atalanta%20B.C.">Atalanta B.C.</a>, <a href="Calcio%20Como">Calcio Como</a>, <a href="A.C.%20Milan">A.C. Milan</a> and <a href="U.S.%20Cremonese">U.S. Cremonese</a>.
For most of his <a href="A.C.%20Milan">A.C. Milan</a> career he was the backup to <a href="Enrico%20Albertosi">Enrico Albertosi</a>, until Albertosi was disqualified in the <a href="Totonero%201980">Totonero 1980</a> betting scandal, and Rigamonti became the first-choice goalkeeper for the last 10 games with Milan.
In a rare case for a goalkeeper, he was a penalty-kick taker with <a href="Calcio%20Como">Calcio Como</a>, scoring 6 goals, including 3 in the Serie A.
